definition.name: NXreflections
definition.doc: This is a definition for reflection data from diffraction experiments

field.name: definition
field.doc: NeXus NXDL schema to which this file conforms

field.name: experiments
field.doc: The experiments from which the reflection data derives

field.name: h
field.doc: The h component of the miller index

field.name: k
field.doc: The k component of the miller index

field.name: l
field.doc: The l component of the miller index

field.name: id
field.doc: The id of the experiment which resulted in the reflection. If the value is greater than 0, the experiments must link to a multi-experiment NXmx group

field.name: reflection_id
field.doc: The id of the reflection. Multiple partials from the same reflection should all have the same id

field.name: entering
field.doc: Is the reflection entering or exiting the Ewald sphere

field.name: det_module
field.doc: The detector module on which the reflection was recorded

field.name: flags
field.doc:
Status flags describing the reflection.
This is a bit mask. The bits in the mask follow the convention used by DIALS, and have the following names:
=== ========================================== bit name === ========================================== 0 ``predicted`` 1 ``observed`` 2 ``indexed`` 3 ``used_in_refinement`` 4 ``strong`` 5 ``reference_spot`` 6 ``dont_integrate`` 7 ``integrated_sum`` 8 ``integrated_prf`` 9 ``integrated`` 10 ``overloaded`` 11 ``overlapped`` 12 ``overlapped_fg`` 13 ``in_powder_ring`` 14 ``foreground_includes_bad_pixels`` 15 ``background_includes_bad_pixels`` 16 ``includes_bad_pixels`` 17 ``bad_shoebox`` 18 ``bad_spot`` 19 ``used_in_modelling`` 20 ``centroid_outlier`` 21 ``failed_during_background_modelling`` 22 ``failed_during_summation`` 23 ``failed_during_profile_fitting`` 24 ``bad_reference`` === ==========================================

field.name: d
field.doc: The resolution of the reflection

field.name: partiality
field.doc: The partiality of the reflection. Dividing by this number will inflate the measured intensity to the full reflection equivalent.

field.name: predicted_frame
field.doc: The frame on which the bragg peak of the reflection is predicted

field.name: predicted_x
field.doc: The x position at which the bragg peak of the reflection is predicted

field.name: predicted_y
field.doc: The y position at which the bragg peak of the reflection is predicted

field.name: predicted_phi
field.doc: The phi angle at which the bragg peak of the reflection is predicted

field.name: predicted_px_x
field.doc: The x pixel position at which the bragg peak of the reflection is predicted

field.name: predicted_px_y
field.doc: The y pixel position at which the bragg peak of the reflection is predicted

field.name: observed_frame
field.doc: The estimate of the frame at which the central impact of the reflection was recorded

field.name: observed_frame_var
field.doc: The variance on the estimate of the frame at which the central impact of the reflection was recorded

field.name: observed_px_x
field.doc: The estimate of the pixel x position at which the central impact of the reflection was recorded

field.name: observed_px_x_var
field.doc: The variance on the estimate of the pixel x position at which the central impact of the reflection was recorded

field.name: observed_px_y
field.doc: The estimate of the pixel y position at which the central impact of the reflection was recorded

field.name: observed_px_y_var
field.doc: The variance on the estimate of the pixel y position at which the central impact of the reflection was recorded

field.name: observed_phi
field.doc: The estimate of the phi angle at which the central impact of the reflection was recorded

field.name: observed_phi_var
field.doc: The variance on the estimate of the phi angle at which the central impact of the reflection was recorded

field.name: observed_x
field.doc: The estimate of the x position at which the central impact of the reflection was recorded

field.name: observed_x_var
field.doc: The variance on the estimate of the x position at which the central impact of the reflection was recorded

field.name: observed_y
field.doc: The estimate of the y position at which the central impact of the reflection was recorded

field.name: observed_y_var
field.doc: The variance on the estimate of the y position at which the central impact of the reflection was recorded

field.name: bounding_box
field.doc:
The bounding box around the recorded recorded reflection. Should be an integer array of length 6, where the 6 values are pixel positions or frame numbers, as follows:
===== =========================== index meaning ===== =========================== 0 The lower pixel x position 1 The upper pixel x position 2 The lower pixel y position 3 The upper pixel y position 4 The lower frame number 5 The upper frame number ===== ===========================

field.name: background_mean
field.doc: The mean background under the reflection peak

field.name: int_prf
field.doc: The estimate of the reflection intensity by profile fitting

field.name: int_prf_var
field.doc: The variance on the estimate of the reflection intensity by profile fitting

field.name: int_sum
field.doc: The estimate of the reflection intensity by summation

field.name: int_sum_var
field.doc: The variance on the estimate of the reflection intensity by summation

field.name: lp
field.doc: The LP correction factor to be applied to the reflection intensities

field.name: prf_cc
field.doc: The correlation of the reflection profile with the reference profile used in profile fitting

field.name: overlaps
field.doc: An adjacency list specifying the spatial overlaps of reflections. The adjacency list is specified using an array data type where the elements of the array are the indices of the adjacent overlapped reflection

field.name: polar_angle
field.doc: Polar angle of reflection centroid, following the NeXus simple (spherical polar) coordinate system

field.name: azimuthal_angle
field.doc: Azimuthal angle of reflection centroid, following the NeXus simple (spherical polar) coordinate system
